intro: Luzula pilosa var. brevicapsula, commonly known as the short-capped wood rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Juncaceae and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and slender, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, clustered spikes of white to greenish flowers during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow, grass-like, and covered in fine, soft hairs. This variety is distinguished by its shorter, more compact inflorescence compared to other Luzula species.
